013package org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation;
014
015import static java.lang.annotation.ElementType.*;
016import static java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy.*;
017
018import java.lang.annotation.*;
019
020import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
021
022/**
023 * Annotation for specifying various XML options for the XML and RDF/XML serializers.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Can be used in the following locations:
027 * <ul>
028 *    <li>Marshalled classes/methods/fields/packages.
029 *    <li><ja>@Rest</ja>-annotated classes and <ja>@RestOp</ja>-annotated methods when an {@link #on()} value is specified.
030 * </ul>
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * Can be used for the following:
034 * <ul>
035 *    <li>Override the child element name on the XML representation of collection or array properties.
036 *    <li>Specify the XML namespace on a package, class, or method.
037 *    <li>Override the XML format on a POJO.
038 * </ul>
039 *
040 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
041 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/XmlBasics">XML Basics</a>
042 * </ul>
043 */
044@Documented
045@Target({TYPE,FIELD,METHOD})
046@Retention(RUNTIME)
047@Inherited
048@Repeatable(XmlAnnotation.Array.class)
049@ContextApply(XmlAnnotation.Apply.class)
050public @interface Xml {
051
052   /**
053    * Sets the name of the XML child elements for bean properties of type collection and array.
054    *
055    * <p>
056    * Applies only to collection and array bean properties.
057    *
058    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
059    * <p class='bjava'>
060    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
061    *       <ja>@Xml</ja>(childName=<js>"child"</js>}
062    *       <jk>public</jk> String[] <jf>children</jf> = {<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>};
063    *    }
064    * </p>
065    *
066    * <p>
067    * Without the <ja>@Xml</ja> annotation, serializing this bean as XML would have produced the following...
068    * <p class='bxml'>
069    *    <xt>&lt;object&gt;</xt>
070    *       <xt>&lt;children&gt;</xt>
071    *          <xt>&lt;string&gt;</xt>foo<xt>&lt;/string&gt;</xt>
072    *          <xt>&lt;string&gt;</xt>bar<xt>&lt;/string&gt;</xt>
073    *       <xt>&lt;/children&gt;</xt>
074    *    <xt>&lt;/object&gt;</xt>
075    * </p>
076    *
077    * <p>
078    * With the annotations, serializing this bean as XML produces the following...
079    * <p class='bxml'>
080    *    <xt>&lt;object&gt;</xt>
081    *       <xt>&lt;children&gt;</xt>
082    *          <xt>&lt;child&gt;</xt>foo<xt>&lt;/child&gt;</xt>
083    *          <xt>&lt;child&gt;</xt>bar<xt>&lt;/child&gt;</xt>
084    *       <xt>&lt;/children&gt;</xt>
085    *    <xt>&lt;/object&gt;</xt>
086    * </p>
087    *
088    * @return The annotation value.
089    */
090   String childName() default "";
091
092    /**
093     * Optional description for the exposed API.
094     *
095     * @return The annotation value.
096     * @since 9.2.0
097     */
098    String[] description() default {};
099
100    /**
101    * The {@link XmlFormat} to use for serializing this object type.
102    *
103    * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
104    * <p class='bjava'>
105    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyBean {
106    *
107    *       <jc>// Normally, bean properties would be rendered as child elements of the bean element.</jc>
108    *       <jc>// Override so that it's rendered as a "f1='123'" attribute on the bean element instead.</jc>
109    *       <ja>@Xml</ja>(format=XmlFormat.<jsf>ATTR</jsf>}
110    *       <jk>public int</jk> <jf>f1</jf> = 123;
111    *
112    *       <jc>// Normally, bean URL properties would be rendered as XML attributes on the bean element.</jc>
113    *       <jc>// Override so that it's rendered as an &lt;href&gt;http://foo&lt;/href&gt; child element instead.</jc>
114    *       <ja>@Beanp</ja>(uri=<jk>true</jk>)
115    *       <ja>@Xml</ja>(format=XmlFormat.<jsf>ELEMENT</jsf>}
116    *       <jk>public</jk> URL <jf>href</jf> = <jk>new</jk> URL(<js>"http://foo"</js>);
117    *
118    *       <jc>// Normally, collection properties would be grouped under a single &lt;children&gt; child element on the bean element.</jc>
119    *       <jc>// Override so that entries are directly children of the bean element with each entry having an element name of &lt;child&gt;.</jc>
120    *       <ja>@Xml</ja>(format=XmlFormat.<jsf>COLLAPSED</jsf>, childName=<js>"child"</js>}
121    *       <jk>public</jk> String[] <jf>children</jf> = <js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>};
122    *    }
123    * </p>
124    *
125    * <p>
126    * Without the <ja>@Xml</ja> annotations, serializing this bean as XML would have produced the following...
127    * <p class='bxml'>
128    *    <xt>&lt;object</xt> <xa>href</xa>=<js>'http://foo'</js><xt>&gt;</xt>
129    *       <xt>&lt;f1&gt;</xt>123<xt>&lt;/f1&gt;</xt>
130    *       <xt>&lt;children&gt;</xt>
131    *          <xt>&lt;string&gt;</xt>foo<xt>&lt;/string&gt;</xt>
132    *          <xt>&lt;string&gt;</xt>bar<xt>&lt;/string&gt;</xt>
133    *       <xt>&lt;/children&gt;</xt>
134    *    <xt>&lt;/object&gt;</xt>
135    * </p>
136    *
137    * <p>
138    * With the annotations, serializing this bean as XML produces the following...
139    * <p class='bxml'>
140    *    <xt>&lt;object</xt> <xa>f1</xa>=<js>'123'</js><xt>&gt;</xt>
141    *       <xt>&lt;href&gt;</xt>http://foo<xt>&lt;/href&gt;</xt>
142    *       <xt>&lt;child&gt;</xt>foo<xt>&lt;/child&gt;</xt>
143    *       <xt>&lt;child&gt;</xt>bar<xt>&lt;/child&gt;</xt>
144    *    <xt>&lt;/object&gt;</xt>
145    * </p>
146    *
147    * @return The annotation value.
148    */
149   XmlFormat format() default XmlFormat.DEFAULT;
150
151   /**
152    * Sets the namespace URI of this property or class.
153    *
154    * <p>
155    * Must be matched with a {@link #prefix()} annotation on this object, a parent object, or a {@link XmlNs @XmlNs} with the
156    * same name through the {@link XmlSchema#xmlNs() @XmlSchema(xmlNs)} annotation on the package.
157    *
158    * @return The annotation value.
159    */
160   String namespace() default "";
161
162   /**
163    * Dynamically apply this annotation to the specified classes/methods/fields.
164    *
165    * <p>
166    * Used in conjunction with {@link org.apache.juneau.BeanContext.Builder#applyAnnotations(Class...)} to dynamically apply an annotation to an existing class/method/field.
167    * It is ignored when the annotation is applied directly to classes/methods/fields.
168    *
169    * <h5 class='section'>Valid patterns:</h5>
170    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
171    *  <li>Classes:
172    *       <ul>
173    *          <li>Fully qualified:
174    *             <ul>
175    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass"</js>
176    *             </ul>
177    *          <li>Fully qualified inner class:
178    *             <ul>
179    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
180    *             </ul>
181    *          <li>Simple:
182    *             <ul>
183    *                <li><js>"MyClass"</js>
184    *             </ul>
185    *          <li>Simple inner:
186    *             <ul>
187    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
188    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2"</js>
189    *                <li><js>"Inner2"</js>
190    *             </ul>
191    *       </ul>
192    *    <li>Methods:
193    *       <ul>
194    *          <li>Fully qualified with args:
195    *             <ul>
196    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
197    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
198    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
199    *             </ul>
200    *          <li>Fully qualified:
201    *             <ul>
202    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod"</js>
203    *             </ul>
204    *          <li>Simple with args:
205    *             <ul>
206    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
207    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
208    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
209    *             </ul>
210    *          <li>Simple:
211    *             <ul>
212    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod"</js>
213    *             </ul>
214    *          <li>Simple inner class:
215    *             <ul>
216    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
217    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
218    *                <li><js>"Inner2.myMethod"</js>
219    *             </ul>
220    *       </ul>
221    *    <li>Fields:
222    *       <ul>
223    *          <li>Fully qualified:
224    *             <ul>
225    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myField"</js>
226    *             </ul>
227    *          <li>Simple:
228    *             <ul>
229    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myField"</js>
230    *             </ul>
231    *          <li>Simple inner class:
232    *             <ul>
233    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
234    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
235    *                <li><js>"Inner2.myField"</js>
236    *             </ul>
237    *       </ul>
238    *    <li>A comma-delimited list of anything on this list.
239    * </ul>
240    *
241    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
242    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/DynamicallyAppliedAnnotations">Dynamically Applied Annotations</a>
243    * </ul>
244    *
245    * @return The annotation value.
246    */
247   String[] on() default {};
248
249   /**
250    * Dynamically apply this annotation to the specified classes.
251    *
252    * <p>
253    * Identical to {@link #on()} except allows you to specify class objects instead of a strings.
254    *
255    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
256    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/DynamicallyAppliedAnnotations">Dynamically Applied Annotations</a>
257    * </ul>
258    *
259    * @return The annotation value.
260    */
261   Class<?>[] onClass() default {};
262
263   /**
264    * Sets the XML prefix of this property or class.
265    *
266    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
267    *    <li>
268    *       When applied to a {@link ElementType#TYPE}, namespace is applied to all properties in the class, and all
269    *       subclasses of the class.
270    *    <li>
271    *       When applied to bean properties on {@link ElementType#METHOD} and {@link ElementType#FIELD}, applies
272    *       to the bean property.
273    * </ul>
274    *
275    * <p>
276    * Must either be matched to a {@link #namespace()} annotation on the same object, parent object, or a
277    * {@link XmlNs @XmlNs} with the same name through the {@link XmlSchema#xmlNs() @XmlSchema(xmlNs)} annotation on the package.
278    *
279    * @return The annotation value.
280    */
281   String prefix() default "";
282}
